meanings.definition: To shout loudly or repeatedly at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The angry coach beshouted instructions to the players on the field.
meanings.sent2: The protesters beshouted their demands outside the government building.
meanings.sent3: The parrot beshouted back at the noisy children in the park.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm beshouted its fury across the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: Her voice beshouted through the quiet room, startling everyone.

meanings.definition: To be filled with loud shouting or noise.
meanings.sent1: The stadium was beshouted with cheers as the home team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: The concert hall beshouted with applause after the amazing performance.
meanings.sent3: The classroom beshouted with excitement when the teacher announced a surprise field trip.
meanings.sent4: The forest beshouted with the calls of various animals at night.
meanings.sent5: The city streets beshouted with the sounds of traffic and honking cars.
